definition: to deal in/to buy and sell/to trade in/to retail/to peddle

sentences.english: The recycling volunteers and the other vendors at the market have all witnessed the change in Lin's personality.
sentences.chinese: 慈濟志工和市場的其他攤販，目睹林江能個性的改變。

sentences.english: This way he thinks he can support small businesses, helping to provide employment opportunities for small stallholders.
sentences.chinese: 他認爲，自己能給許多小企業和小攤販提供工作機會。

sentences.english: The tricky street pedlar cheated the girl into giving him all her money.
sentences.chinese: 狡猾的攤販把小姑娘的錢全騙走了。

sentences.english: The street vendor suggested that I should buy the high-heeled shoes in coffee.
sentences.chinese: 攤販老闆建議我應該買那雙咖啡色的高跟鞋。

sentences.english: The vendor, who also peddles pet turtles, says she is selling more of the stuff these days.
sentences.chinese: 販售小甲魚的攤販告訴我們，她最近賣得比往日好。

sentences.english: Road-side stands are a cheap way to eat.
sentences.chinese: 在路邊的攤販喫東西很便宜。

sentences.english: She was once a government clerk. (See how the Mugabe regime tried to bully the opposition into submission.)
sentences.chinese: 這位小攤販曾是一名政府職員。

sentences.english: In Mexico, I've frequently observed street vendors slipping clean plastic bags over plates.
sentences.chinese: 在墨西哥，我經常看到攤販用乾淨塑料袋裝盤子。

sentences.english: That includes people like labourers, street vendors and domestic workers.
sentences.chinese: 包括勞工，小攤販和本地勞動者。

sentences.english: Thee vendor was only too pleased to oblige and he wrapped both hot dogs in foil.
sentences.chinese: 攤販主很開心，他把兩個熱狗都包了起來。

sentences.english: A mountain of criticism that he is food vendors, hawkers taste to travel incognito.
sentences.chinese: 一山批評攤販食物，小販以爲他是微服出巡的品味使。

sentences.english: Small vendors sold cheesy trinkets and knock-off Olympic souvenirs.
sentences.chinese: 小攤販銷售着各種可愛的小飾物和奧運紀念品。

sentences.english: Stallholders stand behind tiny tightly cluttered stalls.
sentences.chinese: 攤販站在小小的擁擠不堪的攤子後面。

sentences.english: Both urban and rural markets so far in the production of small vendors selling horse roll.
sentences.chinese: 至今在城鄉集市均有小攤販製作馬打滾出售。

definition: to form a long queue (idiom)/(of cars) to be bumper to bumper
market/store/mall (usually specializing in a particular product category such as furniture)
